intro: Moluccella quadrangula, commonly known as the four-cornered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive four-angled stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Moluccella quadrangula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
